executable.title: Synthetic image generation
executable.description: This module is used to make synthetic test images for experimentation and debugging.
executable.contributor: Please direct questions or suggestions to http://groups.google.com/group/plastimatch

parameters.label: Image geometry options
parameters.description: Options that control the size and resolution of the synthetic images

integer-vector.name: plmslc_dim
integer-vector.label: Dimensions
integer-vector.description: This is the resolution of the image in voxels. Use a single number (such as "30") when the x, y, and z dimensions are teh same, or three numbers (such as "512,512,120") when they are different.

float-vector.name: plmslc_origin
float-vector.label: Origin
float-vector.description: This is the location of the center of the first voxel in the image. Use a single number (such as "-145") when the x, y, and z origin values are the same, or three numbers (such as "-250,-250,-100") when they are different.

float-vector.name: plmslc_spacing
float-vector.label: Voxel spacing
float-vector.description: This is the distance between voxels in mm. Use a single number (such as "10") when the x, y, and z voxel spacings are the same, or three numbers (such as "1,1,2.5") when they are different.

parameters.label: Simple pattern options
parameters.description: Options that control what kind of simple geometric paterns are generated

string-enumeration.name: plmslc_pattern
string-enumeration.description: Choose the pattern for the synthetic image
string-enumeration.label: Pattern

float-vector.name: plmslc_rectsize
float-vector.description: Choose the size of the rectangle in mm. Use a single number (such as "20") for a square of size 20. Use three numbers (such as "20,30,10") for a rectangle which has different x, y, and z sizes. Use six numbers (such as "-10,10,-20,20,-30,10") to control the position (not the size) of the six planes of the rectangle: -x,+x,-y,+y,-z,+z.
float-vector.label: Rectangle size

float-vector.name: plmslc_gausscenter
float-vector.description: Choose the position for the center of the Gaussian image in mm. Use a single number (such as "0") when x, y, and z values are the same. Use three numbers (such as "20,30,10") to specify x, y, and z coordinates.
float-vector.label: Gauss center

float-vector.name: plmslc_gausswidth
float-vector.description: Choose the standard deviation of the Gaussian image in mm. Use a single number (such as "20") for isotropic Gaussian of size 20. Use three numbers (such as "20,30,10") for a different x, y, and z widths.
float-vector.label: Gauss width

float-vector.name: plmslc_spherecenter
float-vector.description: Choose the position for the center of the sphere in mm. Use a single number (such as "0") when x, y, and z values are the same. Use three numbers (such as "20,30,10") to specify x, y, and z coordinates.
float-vector.label: Sphere center

float-vector.name: plmslc_spheresize
float-vector.description: Choose the sphere radius in mm. Use a single number (such as "20") for a sphere. Use three numbers (such as "20,30,10") for an ellipsoid with different x, y, and z sizes.
float-vector.label: Sphere size

float-vector.name: plmslc_vol2xlat
float-vector.description: Translation of volume 2 relative to volume 1. Use a single number (such as "20") for 1D translation in the x axis. Use three numbers (such as "20,-5,10") for translation in x, y, and z axes.
float-vector.label: Translate volume 2
